meanings.definition: The office or position of a marshal.
meanings.sent1: In the small town, the marshalships were held by respected community members.
meanings.sent2: The marshalships in the city were crucial for maintaining law and order.
meanings.sent3: The marshalships were so popular that even the children played pretend marshals in the park.
meanings.sent4: She took on the marshalships with determination, ensuring justice prevailed in the town.
meanings.sent5: The marshalships symbolized authority and leadership in the old western movies.

meanings.definition: The duties or responsibilities of a marshal.
meanings.sent1: The marshalships involved patrolling the streets and keeping the community safe.
meanings.sent2: He carried out his marshalships diligently, earning the respect of the townspeople.

meanings.definition: The act of organizing or arranging in a systematic or orderly way.
meanings.sent1: Her marshalships of the event ensured everything ran smoothly and on time.
meanings.sent2: The successful execution of the project was credited to his excellent marshalships.
meanings.sent3: The marshalships of the books on the shelf made them look neat and tidy.
